com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body
Class ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes

java.lang.Object
  com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
      com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBody
          com.beaglebuddy.mp3.id3v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes

public class ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes
extends ID3v23FrameBody

An event timing codes frame body is associated with an ID3v2.3 ETCO frame which is used to synchronize key events in a song. The event timing codes frame body contains the following fields:

Event Timing Codes Frame Body Fields
 FieldDescription
1. time stamp formatunits of the time stamp field.
2. eventCode indicates which of the pre-defined event codes the event is.

Terminating the start events such as "intro start" is not required. You may use any of the USER_DEFINED_EVENT_X codes to define your own event. You might want to synchronise your music to something, like setting of an explosion on-stage, or turning on your screensaver, etc. There may be only one event timing codes frame.

See Also:
ID3v23Frame, ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

Constructor Detail

ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes

public ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes()
The default constructor is called when creating a new frame. The default values used are:
  • time stamp format in milliseconds

ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes

public ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes(TimeStampFormat timeStampFormat,
                                       EventCode eventCode)
This constructor is called when creating a new frame.

Parameters:
timeStampFormat - units of the time stamp. see ID3v23FrameBody.setTimeStampFormat(TimeStampFormat)
eventCode - pre-defined event code. see setEventCode(EventCode)

ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes

public ID3v23FrameBodyEventTimingCodes(java.io.FileInputStream file,
                                       int frameBodySize)
                                throws java.io.IOException
This constructor is called when reading in an existing frame from an .mp3 file. This is then followed by a call to the parse() method.

Parameters:
file - input stream pointing to a event timing codes frame body in the .mp3 file.
frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading the frame body.

parse

public void parse(FrameType frameType)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
parses the raw bytes of the frame body and stores the parsed values in the frame's fields.

Overrides:
parse in class ID3v23FrameBody
Parameters:
frameType - the type of ID3v2.3 frame.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid value is detected while parsing the frame body's raw bytes.

setEventCode

public void setEventCode(EventCode eventCode)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
ValueDescription
0x00 padding (has no meaning)
0x01 end of initial silence
0x02 intro start
0x03 mainpart start
0x04 outro start
0x05 outro end
0x06 verse start
0x07 refrain start
0x08 interlude start
0x09 theme start
0x0A variation start
0x0B key change
0x0C time change
0x0D momentary unwanted noise (Snap, Crackle & Pop)
0x0E sustained noise
0x0F sustained noise end
0x10 intro end
0x11 mainpart end
0x12 verse end
0x13 refrain end
0x14 theme end
0x15-0xDF reserved for future use
0xE0-0xEF not predefined sync 0-F. Can be used by the user to define their own events.
0xF0-0xFC reserved for future use
0xFD audio end (start of silence)
0xFE audio file ends
0xFF one more byte of events follows (all the following bytes with the value 0xFF have the same function)

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the event code is not a valid event code (ie, reserved for future use).

setBuffer

public void setBuffer()
If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw binary buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.

Overrides:
setBuffer in class ID3v23FrameBody

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a string representation of the frame body.
